note.p: Education: St Dunstan's College Catford; scholarship to University College London , graduating with a first class honours degree (1905-1908); Ph.D at Heidelberg

Career: Served in the Royal Garrison Artillery and mentioned in dispatches in 1914-1918 war. Professor of Physics at Ordnance College Woolwich (1920-1928). Science correspondent of the Times newspaper (1945-1952).Quain Professor of Physics, University of London (University College)
Freemason, initated 1 November 1921, passed 6 December 1921 and raised 7 February 1922, Savage Club Lodge No. 2190 London
Lectures: Wilkins Lecture 1949; Rutherford Memorial Lecture 1957
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1972 vol 18 pp 1-20, plate, by Alan Cottrell
References: R V J, review of Gwendy Caroe, The Royal Institution: An Informal History in NR 1986-87 vol 41 pp 107-110
'Freemasons and the Royal Society: Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' 2010. Library and Museum of Freemasonry.
